message.content:
1)  Analysis of the Main Target Image

•  Block Count and Layers  
   – There are a total of 8 blocks in the structure:  
     • 3 red “arch” blocks forming the base layer.  
     • 1 yellow rectangular block laid horizontally on top of the red arches.  
     • 2 green rectangular “pillar” blocks standing vertically on top of that yellow block.  
     • 1 yellow rectangular block bridging across the tops of the two green pillars.  
     • 1 orange triangular block resting at the very top.  
   – Hence, you can think of it in three main levels:  
     1) The bottom (red arches)  
     2) A middle “frame” (one yellow beam + two green pillars)  
     3) The top (the second yellow beam + orange triangle)  

•  Spatial Relationships  
   – The 3 red arch blocks stand side by side, arches facing forward, forming a level base.  
   – A single yellow beam spans across the tops of these arches.  
   – Two tall green pillars are placed vertically onto that yellow beam, near its left and right ends.  
   – A second yellow beam then rests on top of those green pillars, bridging them.  
   – Finally, the orange triangular block is centered on the upper yellow beam.  

2)  Selecting Blocks from the Dictionary

To match shape, color, and orientation exactly (no re‐orientations allowed), use:

• Red arches (3 copies): Block #1  
  (The arch faces you from the front, matching the base layer.)  
• Green vertical pillars (2 copies): Block #8  
  (A tall green rectangular prism standing upright.)  
• Yellow horizontal beams (2 copies): Block #10  
  (Short golden‐yellow rectangular prism laid left‐to‐right.)  
• Orange triangular top (1 copy): Block #13  
  (Orange wedge oriented with the triangular face upward.)  

3)  Assembly Order

Below is a simple step‐by‐step sequence (by dictionary index).  You may of course position them carefully so that the arches and beams align exactly:
{
  Step1: Move block with index 1
  Step2: Move block with index 1
  Step3: Move block with index 1
  Step4: Move block with index 10
  Step5: Move block with index 8
  Step6: Move block with index 8
  Step7: Move block with index 10
  Step8: Move block with index 13
}
